sen.j: 冷泉天皇（れいぜいてんのう、天暦4年5月24日（950年6月12日）- 寛弘8年10月24日（1011年11月21日）、在位：康保4年10月11日（967年11月15日） - 安和2年8月13日（969年9月27日））は、第63代の平安時代中期の天皇。
sen.e: Emperor REIZEI (June 12th, 950 - November 21st, 1011), his reign was November 15th, 967 - September 27th, 969, he was the 63rd Emperor in middle Heian Period.
Emperor Reizei (June 12, 950 - November 21, 1011) was the sixty-third emperor (his reign was in the mid-Heian period, from November 15, 967 to September 27, 969).
Emperor Reizei (June 12, 950 - November 21, 1011) was the sixty-third emperor (his reign was in the mid-Heian period, from November 15, 967 to September 27, 969).

sen.j: 村上天皇の第二皇子。
sen.e: He was the 2nd Prince of Emperor MURAKAMI.
He was the 2nd Prince of Emperor Murakami.
He was the second prince of Emperor Murakami.

sen.j: 憲平（のりひら）親王。
sen.e: His name was Prince Norihira.
His name was Prince Norihira.
His name was Prince Norihira.

sen.j: 母は藤原師輔の娘中宮藤原安子。
sen.e: Mother was FUJIWARA no Morosuke' daughter, the second consort of an emperor, FUJIWARA no Anshi.
His mother was FUJIWARA no Anshi, the daughter of FUJIWARA no Morosuke, the second consort of an Emperor.
His mother was FUJIWARA no Anshi, the daughter of FUJIWARA no Morosuke, the second consort of an Emperor.

sen.j: 円融天皇の同母兄。
sen.e: He was half older brother of Emperor ENYU.
He was the older half-brother of Emperor Enyu.
He was the older half-brother of Emperor Enyu.

sen.j: 第一皇子の広平親王を押しのけて生後間もなく立太子。
sen.e: He edged out Prince Hirohira and became Crown Prince soon after he was born.
He was chosen over Prince Hirohira and became the crown prince soon after his birth.
He was chosen over Prince Hirohira and became the crown prince soon after his birth.

sen.j: 時の権力者である藤原実頼・師輔の兄弟の力が働いていたと思われる。
sen.e: It is presumed FUJIWARA no Saneyori, Morosuke brothers who were in the leadership position during this period helped Emperor REIZEI to become Crown Prince.
It is presumed that FUJIWARA no Saneyori, a brother of Morosuke, who were in the leadership position during this period, assisted in making the future Emperor Reizei the crown prince.
It is presumed that the brothers, FUJIWARA no Saneyori and Morosuke, who were in the leadership position during this period, assisted in making the future Emperor Reizei the crown prince.
sen.cmt: 「藤原実頼・師輔の兄弟」部分の訳修正

sen.j: 康保4年（967年）、村上天皇の崩御を受けて18歳で即位。
sen.e: In 967 he succeeded to the throne when he was eighteen years old after Emperor MURAKAMI died.
In 967, he succeeded to the throne at age 18, following the death of Emperor Murakami.
In 967, he succeeded to the throne at age 18, following the death of Emperor Murakami.

sen.j: この時初めて紫宸殿で即位式を行った。
sen.e: There was an enthronement ceremony at Shishin-den (the Hall for State Ceremonies) for the first time.
For the first time there was an enthronement ceremony at Shishin-den (the hall designated for state ceremonies).
For the first time there was an enthronement ceremony at Shishin-den (the hall designated for state ceremonies).

sen.j: 精神に病があり皇太子の時代から問題になっていたことから、藤原実頼が関白についた。
sen.e: The Emperor had a metal problem since he was Crown Prince thus FUJIWAEA no Saneyori became chancellor(chief advisor to the emperor).
The Emperor had suffered a mental problem since he was the crown prince, and therefore FUJIWAEA no Saneyori became chancellor(chief advisor to the Emperor).
The Emperor had suffered mental illness since he was the crown prince, and therefore FUJIWAEA no Saneyori became chancellor (chief advisor to the Emperor).

sen.j: 村上天皇の第四皇子為平親王と、守平親王の間で冷泉天皇の皇太子（皇太弟）をめぐって安和の変があり、安和2年（969年）、円融天皇（守平親王）に譲位。
sen.e: There was an the Anna Incident and Prince Tamehira, Emperor MURAKAMI's 4th Prince, and Prince Morihira fought against each other to become Crown Prince during Emperor REIZEI's reign, Emperor ENYU (Prince Morihira) became Crown Prince in 969.

The Anna Incident took place, and Prince Tamehira, Emperor Murakami's fourth prince, and Prince Morihira fought against each other to become crown prince during Emperor Reizei's reign; consequently, Emperor Enyu (Prince Morihira) became the crown prince in 969.

The Anna Incident took place, and Prince Tamehira, the fourth prince of Emperor Murakami, and Prince Morihira fought each other to become the crown prince during Emperor Reizei's reign; consequently, Emperor Enyu (Prince Morihira) became the Emperor in 969.

sen.j: 譲位後は冷泉院上皇と称される。
sen.e: After the Emperor passed the throne to Emperor Enyu, he was called the ex-Emperor Reizei-in.
After the Emperor passed the throne to Emperor Enyu, he became known as ex-Emperor Reizei-in.
After the Emperor passed the throne to Emperor Enyu, he became known as Retired Emperor Reizei-in.

sen.j: 62歳で崩御。
sen.e: He died sixty two years old.
He died at 62 years of age.
He died at 62 years of age.

sen.j: 記録では死因は赤痢とされている。
sen.e: It is said he died of dysentery.
It is said that he died of dysentery.
It is said that he died of dysentery.

sen.j: 以後後一条天皇の即位まで約50年間弟の円融系との皇位迭立が続き、円融系を父方、冷泉系を母方とする曾孫の後三条天皇の即位で両皇統は融合される事となった。
sen.e: After that the Imperial Throne was shared with his Brother of Enyu line for fifty years until Emperor GO-ICHIJO succeeded to the throne, the Imperial line was fused together after Emperor GO-SANJO enthroned who was a great-grandchild form both lines, having mother from REIZEI line and father from ENYU line.

Subsequently, the Imperial Throne was shared with his brother of Enyu line for 50 years until Emperor Go-Ichijo succeeded to the throne; the Imperial line was fused together after the enthronement of Emperor Go-Sanjo, who was a great-grandchild from both lines, having his mother from the ReizeiI line and his father from the Enyu line.

Subsequently, the Imperial Throne was shared with his brother (from the Enyu line) for about 50 years until Emperor Go-Ichijo succeeded to the throne; the Imperial line was brought together after the enthronement of Emperor Go-Sanjo, who was a great-grandchild from both lines, having his mother from the Reizei line and his father from the Enyu line.

sen.j: 上皇になった際の名称は、現在の二条城の東北に嵯峨天皇が造営した離宮「冷然院」が後に後院（上皇の御所）となった「冷泉院」に由来する。
sen.e: His name as an ex-emperor came from 'Reizei in', which was built by Emperor SAGA on north-east of current Nijo-castle as his detached palace; an Imperial villa called 'Reizei in' and later became Go-in. (ex-emperor's palace)

His name as an ex-emperor came from 'Reizei in', which was built by Emperor Saga on the northeast of the current Nijo-castle as his detached palace; an imperial villa that later became Go-in. (ex-emperor's palace).

His name as an retired emperor came from 'Reizei in,' which was built by Emperor Saga on the northeast of the current Nijo-jo Castle as his detached palace; it was an imperial villa that later became Go-in (retired emperor's palace).
sen.cmt: カンマを'内に移動Nijo-castle→Nijo-jo castle"ex-emperor"→"retired emperor"に変更しました。

sen.j: 冷泉天皇は容姿が非常に端麗であったが、皇太子時代から精神の病ゆえの奇行が目立った。
sen.e: He was a well looking Emperor however he had some strange behavior due to his insanity since he was Crown Prince.
He was a well looking Emperor, but since his days as the crown prince he had exhibited strange behavior due to his insanity.
Emperor Reizei appeared physically healthy, but since his days as the crown prince he had exhibited strange behavior that belied his insanity.

sen.j: 大江匡房が記した『江記』などにより、以下のエピソードが挙げられる。
sen.e: There are following episode in "Go ki" written by OE no Masafusa.
There are the following episodes in "Go ki," written by OE no Masafusa.
There are the following episodes in "Go ki," written by OE no Masafusa.

sen.j: 足が傷つくのも全く構わず、一日中蹴鞠を続けた。
sen.e: He kept of kicking a ball of kemari (a game played by aristocrats in the Heian period) not minding his foot getting hurt.
He continually kicked a ball in kemari (a game played by aristocrats in the Heian period) without minding that his foot was getting hurt.
He continually kicked a kemari ball (a game played by aristocrats of the Heian period) without minding that his foot was getting hurt.

sen.j: 父帝（村上天皇）に手紙の返事として、男性の陰茎が大きく描かれた絵を送りつけた。
sen.e: He continued to send letters back to his father, Emperor MURAKAMI the large pictures of penis.
He continued to send letters back to his father, Emperor Murakami containing pictures of his enlarged penis.
He continued to send letters back to his father, Emperor Murakami, containing pictures of an enlarged penis.

sen.j: 清涼殿近くの番小屋の屋根の上に座り込んだ。
sen.e: He sat down on the roof of caretaker's lodge near Seiryo-den. (Emperor's residence)
He sat down on the roof of the caretaker's lodge near Seiryo-den (the Emperor's residence).
He sat down on the roof of the caretaker's lodge near Seiryo-den (the Emperor's residence).

sen.j: 病気で床に伏していた時、大声で歌を歌っていた。
sen.e: When he was in bed with his illness, he was singing a song with loud voice.
When he was in bed with his illness, he would sing in a loud voice.
When he was in bed with his illness, he would sing in a loud voice.

sen.j: 退位後に住んでいた御所が火事になった折、避難するときに牛車の中で大声で歌を歌った。
sen.e: When there was a fire at his palace, Gosho after he abdicated the throne, as he was escaping to the safe place, he was singing loudly inside the cow carriage.
When there was a fire at his palace (Gosho) after he abdicated the throne, as he was escaping to a safe place he sang loudly inside the cow-drawn carriage.
When there was a fire at his palace (Gosho) after he abdicated the throne, as he was escaping to a safe place he sang loudly inside the cow-drawn carriage.

sen.j: 儀式の最中に「こんな重いものは被っていられない」といきなり冠を脱ぎ、近く使えていた馬命婦を帳の中に強引に引き入れて姦した。
sen.e: During an official ceremony, he took off his crown suddenly by saying, 'I can not wear this heavy thing any more' and pulled Uma no myobu's arm aggressively, who was serving near him, into the room with partition and raped her.

During an official ceremony, he took off his crown suddenly and, saying, 'I cannot wear this heavy thing anymore,' he pulled Uma no myobu's arm aggressively, who was serving near him, into the room with a partition and raped her.

During an official ceremony, he took off his crown suddenly and, saying, 'I cannot wear this heavy thing anymore,' he pulled Uma no myobu's arm aggressively, who was serving near him, into the room with a partition and raped her.

sen.j: これらの奇行と当時の摂政だった藤原実頼と外戚関係を持たず、逆に有力な跡継ぎとされていた為平親王が伯父の源高明を舅とし、藤原氏を刺激した（安和の変の伏線となる）事等が僅か2年で退位する原因となった。
sen.e: (Despite of above strange behavior), Emperor REIZEI was considered to be a powerful successor to the throne who did not have maternal relationship with regent during this time, FUJIWARA no Saneyori. vEmperor REIZEI abdicated only within two years after his enthronement, the reason being Prince Tamehira's father in law was MINAMOTO no Takaakira and it inflamed the FUJIWARA clan. (it became a foreshadowing of the Anna Incident.)

In addition to the above strange behavior, Emperor Reizei had no maternal relationship with the regent, FUJIWARA no Saneyori, and Prince Tamehira, who was considered to be a powerful successor to the throne, had MINAMOTO no Takaakira as father-in-law; this inflamed the FUJIWARA clan (and became a foreshadowing of the Anna Incident), and consequently Emperor Reizei abdicated within just two years after his enthronement.

In addition to the above strange behavior, Emperor Reizei had no maternal relationship with the regent, FUJIWARA no Saneyori, and Imperial Prince Tamehira, who was considered to be a powerful successor to the throne, had MINAMOTO no Takaakira as father-in-law; this inflamed the FUJIWARA clan (and became a foreshadowing of the Anna Incident), and consequently Emperor Reizei abdicated within just two years after his enthronement.

sen.j: もっとも退位後は在位時のプレッシャーがなくなったのか、61歳まで生きたが、師貞親王(花山天皇)をはじめとする皇子女や弟円融天皇、その皇子の一条天皇等多くの親族に先立たれたのは皮肉な事であった。
sen.e: However after the abdication, the ex-Emperor REIZEI lived until sixty one years old, presumably due to not having too much stress that he had when in power, it was ironic that his relatives like Prince Morosada (the Emperor Kazan), or other Princes and Princesses, his brother Emperor ENYU and his Prince Emperor ICHIJO passed away before Emperor REIZEI.

However, after the abdication the ex-emperor Reizei lived to the age of 61, presumably due to not having too much stress that he had when in power; it was ironic that his relatives like Prince Morosada (the Emperor Kazan) or other princes and princesses, his brother Emperor Enyu and his Prince (Emperor) Ichijo, passed away before him.

However, after the abdication the Retired Emperor Reizei lived to the age of 61, presumably due to not having too much stress that he had when in power; it was ironic that his relatives like Prince Morosada (the Emperor Kazan) or other princes and princesses, his brother Emperor Enyu and his Prince (Emperor) Ichijo, passed away before him.

sen.j: しかし、天皇の血統は確実に孫娘の禎子内親王をもって、没後円融系と融合される事となったのである。
sen.e: But his Imperial line certainly fused together with Princess Teishi and Emperor ENYU's line after his death.
However, his imperial line certainly fused together with Princess Teishi and Emperor Enyu's line after his death.
However, his imperial line certainly fused together with Princess Teishi and Emperor Enyu's line after his death.

sen.j: 康保
sen.e: Koho
Koho
Koho

sen.j: 安和
sen.e: Anna
Anna
Anna

sen.j: 京都市左京区鹿ヶ谷の桜本陵
sen.e: It is in Sakura moto no misasagi in Shishi ga tani, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
It is in Sakura moto no misasagi in Shishi ga tani, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
It is in Sakura moto no misasagi in Shishi ga tani, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
